title: Why does it seem Firefox does things differently besides guarding my seach when It comes to printing and missing files?
content: I'm a little frustrated with Firefox and how things are setup. First, when I had a Firefox or Mozilla I changed computers and when I signed in on the new computer I went to for stored files and hit the start button and went to where my files were stored they were missing. Just now, I guess I asked for help and I to hit the contact button and then hit it again till finally I got to a page that I could at least ask someone for help. So who ever sees my question please try to help me or tell me the secret to asking support. I asked this question before thinking support would see it but I had zero reply's. I guess I asked a stupid question and the no reply was what? A reason not to reply? They didn't have an answer? Who knows? I just wanted to find out about my stored files. I'm I supposed to reconnect my old computer to find them? I have another question about printing and Firefox's unique way of storing them different from other browsers? I'll ask that later. Thank you for enabling me to be able to search without worrying if it's private. Others browsers don't! Please try and help me. Not everyone has deep computer knowledge so I do need help. Thanks, Rob A
creator: colleenandrob

title: Connection problem
content:
The other day, I logged in to firefox from the firefox private page at a nekafe. When I got home, I woke up my home PC and tried to connect to the Internet, but it gave me a warning that it was set to connect manually to the wifi of the cafe and would not automatically select my home server.

At that time, I was able to manually select and connect to the wifi without any problems, but today, a few days later, a new firefox window opened separately from the work window, saying "You are not connected to the Wi-Fi in the store.

It seems that something in the connection settings has changed, but what should I look for to change it back?

Please help me find a solution.

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)
creator: alfa_33jp

creator: omidsolo

title: The "New TAB" command.
content:
Since back in 2004, some releases perform as the following: Open a TAB. See a link you would like tp open as a new Tab.

EITHER CAN HAPPEN: 1. It put that link as a "NEW TAB" AND the Cursor STAYS WHERE IT IS. Allowing you to select more links to create MORE NEW TABS, etc.

2. It put that link as a "NEW TAB AND MOVES THE cursor TO THE NEW TAB JUST CREATED and you are no longer on the original TAB and can not create/move more links to new tabs.

90% of the time I prefer to STAY so I can create multiple LINKS as NEW TABS, THEN go to the new tabs for viewing.

is that an OPTION or a "NEW FEATURE"?
creator: jagman55

title: playing you tube tutorials
content: Lately you tube tutorials & videos play for a few seconds. than stop. The spinning wheel appears (presumably reloading) and than it continues but WITHOUT sound. Upon restarting Firefox it happens again and again, rendering it useless. If I use google chrome this phenomenon does not appear, same for Opera - only firefox. What to do?

title: How do I get off of the beta channel?
content:
I have two versions of Firefox installed on my work PC, the regular one for my everyday browsing and the Developer's Edition for my work with the regular one being my default browser. For some reason, through no effort on my part, I ended up on the beta channel for the regular browser.

That was OK until the latest beta (version 90) started showing an extremely annoying bug. On a daily basis, on average, it will stop loading pages for no reason. For that reason, I'd like to get off of the beta channel and get back to using the release version. Would uninstalling the beta version and installing the release version do that for me? Or will I somehow end up back on the beta channel and get upgraded to the beta version again? (If I do have to uninstall the beta and install the release, I want to keep all of the settings, bookmarks, plugins, etc. that I have in that browser. I have the Dev Edition browser set up to never sync, so it has a different set of settings, etc., which I don't want carried over to the other browser.)
creator: rholstein
